reviewText: This film sucks!End of story!However,Mst3k did a great job!If you have seen the Mst3k episode,you know what im talking about!Things to look out for:Crow:"Summer festering,""We are currently rocking,"and my favorite (In James brown voice" The SOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUULLLLLLLLtaker!
summary: Boring!Mst3k did a great job of making fun of it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the best episodes of Mystery Science Theater 3000 and the better the episode the worse the movie.  The show did a good job at pointing out all of the mistakes of the movie.  Joe Esteves did a terrible  job in that movie.  The plot was terrible and did not make sense.  This was  film was very boring.  I got tired of seeing that guy run around the  hospital.  I even read Blockbuster Video's review for this movie.  They  used just one word to describe this film and that was 'tedious.'  If you  buy this film and then watch it, you will be bored to tears.  If you  only watch it on MST3k, you will laugh your head off.  As I  said before, the better the episode the worse the movie.
summary: It has to be really bad to be on MST3k.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Check out SOULTAKER to see the original "Death Angel" film that inspired the "Final Destination" series, plus "City of Angels", "Dead Like Me" and a dozen other wanna-be's.  Leave it to some creative indies in Mobile, Alabama, to invent a new genre' of thriller that Hollywood has tried over-and-over again to copy.  Be sure to watch the actual feature of "SOULTAKER" (at 97-minutes) instead of the abomination chop version of MST-3000 at 60-minutes that removed all of the plot and suspense in favor of comic possibilities of out-of-context moments.  If you haven't seen the full feature of "SOULTAKER," you haven't seen the film, period.
summary: Kudos to the first and still the best 'death angel' movie!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw this on MST3K last year and it was TERRIBLE!  Cheesy late 80s music, a guy that looks like Bob Vila, and godawful acting. The scenes at the summer festival(or as Crow called it, the "summer festering") and  the Kwik-E-Mart were just totally dumb. Especially the part where the one  guy, who is visible but dead, smashes a jar of pickles on the floor to get  the worker's attention. HELLO? You're DEAD!I was totally shocked to see  that this was on video AND DVD. Why in the world is this on DVD?Rated  'R' and not to be sold to persons under 18, you say? IMHO, it's rated 'R'  for "retarded" and shouldn't be sold to persons at ANY  age!So, please, PLEASE only see this on MST3K(if they ever rerun this  episode again before Sci-Fi's lease runs out on the show).
Title: N/A

reviewText: A guy from the wrong side of the tracks and the mayors daughter are the only survivors of a car wreck. Or are they? Charlie Sheen's brother and the guy from the Maniac Cop movies follow the teen couple around after-hours  Alabama before the teens can get their souls back into their bodies at the  hospital. There is more pointless running away than in a  "Halloween" knock-off, and the villains aren't scary, they're  just a couple of dorky middle-aged guys looking for an acting job. ANY  acting job. Much better when viewed "Mike & the Bots-Style"  with plenty of insults hurled at the screen!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Thank-you so very much. This is everything that I expected and I appreciate this seller adjusting their price so that I could afford to get this movie. I've been searching for it since the first time I saw it on the Sci-Fi Channel many years ago. I didn't even know that Martin Sheen  had a sibling until this movie. He should still be making movies.

reviewText: Sid the Elf is quite the complex character that offer ponders many of lives great mysteries. But one question seems to weigh heavy on our minds this evening. That question being, how does Martin Sheen cope with being overshadowed by the success of his better acting younger brother Joe Estevez? Clearly there is no comparison between the two as Joe's resume of outstanding B wipes anything Martin has produced off the face of the planet. It's a battle we've come accustomed to with other great sibling rivalries like that of Don vs. Patrick, Chad vs. Steve, and Mike vs. Chuck. It's what makes the film world go around. Thankfully for us all the true actors in the family pump out exactly what revs Sid's engine by blessing us with pure B dynamite. What better way to kick off our favorite decade then with the 1990 release of Soultaker starring Joe Estevez. Yeah you heard us right we said starring.Soultaker starts off with a car full of mullets as they head down to skeem on some ladies at the local summerfest. Unbeknownst to our three winners they are not alone on their journey. They are being stalked by Soultaker Joe Estevez and his boss the Angel of Death (Robert Z'Dar). Now this Angel of Death looked very familiar and was recognized as the giant headed villain fromRed Linethat got the slow motion treatment Halloween 4 style. That was an instant star right there right there. See soultaker Joe is under his monthly quota and needs some souls in a hurry so he decides to take down the three cool cats and the very sub-par lady they pick up. Once he makes them crash into a tree he must one by one capture their souls before midnight or he get's booted out of the death industry and will be forced to sleep in his older brother Martin's shed. However the main stud Brad has other plans and goes mano a mano with the mighty Joe Estevez to reclaim their B lives so they can go on to make more horrible movies.Soultaker was another much needed dose of our favorite Estevez. After a breathtaking performance as a crooked detective inArmed for Action [VHS] we decided to dedicate more time to putting a dent in Joe's works. We've seen him in a handful of movies but feel he deserves the royal treatment in moving forward with our B careers. Besides his hilarious performance as the reaper the supporting cast did a great job providing plenty of laughs. We also got a bit of help since we watched the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version which really boosts this film into a ten star event. What's nice for us is to see that there are so many top notch films from the 90's that still must be watched and reviewed by the world's most renowned B enthusiasts. It was a great time in our lives that's given us more then our fair share of laughs thanks to the never ending variety of B.
summary: Why choose Soultaker? Two Words: JOE ESTEVEZ
Title: N/A

reviewText: This hokum about souls trying to get back to their bodies while evading the angel of death, who is also an angel of mediocre acting, is good only in the way that old films like Deadly Mantis, Billy The Kid Vs. Dracula or Catwomen Of The Moon are good. It is sheer camp in every way right through the script, the story, the acting and the direction. Wait till you see the wooden acting of Joe Estevez and the huge-headed Robert Zdar. Calling their performances funny is an understatement; you have to see this to believe it, although I'm not sure it's worth the current price (as of this writing) of more than $20. There are many GREAT fantasy and SF movies you can buy now for less than $10, so why this junk is still so expensive is a bit of a mystery.If you are looking for grade-B campy fun or are willing to suspend your disbelief for the most superstitious and ridiculous plot premises, then you'll enjoy this, otherwise, steer clear. If you enjoy films that are so bad they are funny, if possible you may wish to do yourself a favor and see the Mystery Science Theater 3000 episode where they make fun of this movie. It's hilarious!
Title: N/A
